Title: A Survey of using Large Language Models for Generating Infrastructure as Code
Evidence: "Finally, we conclude by presenting the challenges in this area and highlighting the scope for future research."

Title: Injecting New Knowledge into Large Language Models via Supervised Fine-Tuning
Evidence: "adapting these models to incorporate new, out-of-domain knowledge remains a challenge, particularly for facts and events that occur after the model's knowledge cutoff date."

Title: DataAgent: Evaluating Large Language Models' Ability to Answer Zero-Shot, Natural Language Queries
Evidence: The abstract focuses on evaluating OpenAI's GPT-3.5 as a "Language Data Scientist" and its performance in answering data science queries. It does not mention any limitations of LLMs.

Title: On-the-fly Definition Augmentation of LLMs for Biomedical NER
Evidence: "Despite their general capabilities, LLMs still struggle on biomedical NER tasks, which are difficult due to the presence of specialized terminology and lack of training data."

Title: ITCMA: A Generative Agent Based on a Computational Consciousness Structure
Evidence: "Large Language Models (LLMs) still face challenges in tasks requiring understanding implicit instructions and applying common-sense knowledge. In such scenarios, LLMs may require multiple attempts to achieve human-level performance, potentially leading to inaccurate responses or inferences in practical environments, affecting their long-term consistency and behavior."

Title: Retrieval-Enhanced Knowledge Editing for Multi-Hop Question Answering in Language Models
Evidence: "Large Language Models (LLMs) have shown proficiency in question-answering tasks but often struggle to integrate real-time knowledge updates, leading to potentially outdated or inaccurate responses." and "This problem becomes even more challenging when dealing with multi-hop questions since they require LLMs to update and integrate multiple knowledge pieces relevant to the questions."

Title: Mixed Preference Optimization: Reinforcement Learning with Data Selection and Better Reference Model
Evidence: "LLMs can inherit harmful biases and produce outputs that are not aligned with human values" and "analyzing the stability and robustness of RLHF and DPO, we propose MPO (Mixed Preference Optimization), a novel method that mitigates the weaknesses of both approaches."

Title: FACTOID: FACtual enTailment fOr hallucInation Detection
Evidence: "However, hallucination is a significant concern." and "This paper argues that conventional TE methods are inadequate for spotting hallucinations in content generated by LLMs." and "aims to detect factual inaccuracies in content generated by LLMs while also highlighting the specific text segment that contradicts reality."

Title: Dual Instruction Tuning with Large Language Models for Mathematical Reasoning
Evidence: "Despite the fine-tuned LLMs, challenges persist, such as incorrect, missing, and redundant steps in CoT generation leading to inaccuracies in answer predictions."

Title: Boosting Conversational Question Answering with Fine-Grained Retrieval-Augmentation and Self-Check
Evidence: "Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) aims to generate more reliable and accurate responses, by augmenting large language models (LLMs) with the external vast and dynamic knowledge." The abstract focuses on improving LLMs with retrieval-augmentation and does not discuss their limitations.

Title: Aligning Large Language Models for Enhancing Psychiatric Interviews through Symptom Delineation and Summarization
Evidence: "Recent advancements in Large Language Models (LLMs) have accelerated their usage in various domains... Our experimental results show that appropriately prompted LLMs can achieve high performance on both the symptom delineation task and the summarization task."

Title: PropTest: Automatic Property Testing for Improved Visual Programming
Evidence: "Visual Programming has emerged as an alternative to end-to-end black-box visual reasoning models. This type of methods leverage Large Language Models (LLMs) to decompose a problem and generate the source code for an executable computer program."

Title: LARA: Linguistic-Adaptive Retrieval-Augmented LLMs for Multi-Turn Intent Classification
Evidence: "Multi-turn intent classification is notably challenging due to the complexity and evolving nature of conversational contexts." and "LARA tackles these issues by combining a fine-tuned smaller model with a retrieval-augmented mechanism, integrated within the architecture of LLMs."

Title: CodeS: Natural Language to Code Repository via Multi-Layer Sketch
Evidence: "The impressive performance of large language models (LLMs) on code-related tasks has shown the potential of fully automated software development."

Title: Synthesize Step-by-Step: Tools, Templates and LLMs as Data Generators for Reasoning-Based Chart VQA
ChatDBG: An AI-Powered Debugging Assistant
Evidence: "ChatDBG integrates large language models (LLMs) to significantly enhance the capabilities and user-friendliness of conventional debuggers."

Title: A Chain-of-Thought Prompting Approach with LLMs for Evaluating Students' Formative Assessment Responses in Science
Evidence: "A systematic analysis of our method's pros and cons sheds light on the potential for human-in-the-loop techniques to enhance automated grading for open-ended science assessments."

Title: Summing Up the Facts: Additive Mechanisms Behind Factual Recall in LLMs
Evidence: "We find that the mechanistic story behind factual recall is more complex than previously thought." The abstract focuses on understanding how LLMs store and retrieve knowledge, particularly in the context of factual recall, but it does not discuss limitations of LLMs in detail.

Title: CPSDBench: A Large Language Model Evaluation Benchmark and Baseline for Chinese Public Security Domain
Evidence: "Through the in-depth analysis and evaluation conducted in this research, we not only enhance our understanding of the performance strengths and limitations of existing models in addressing public security issues but also provide references for the future development of more accurate and customized LLM models targeted at applications in this field."

Title: GraphTranslator: Aligning Graph Model to Large Language Model for Open-ended Tasks
Evidence: "Although several methods applying LLMs to graphs have been proposed, they fail to simultaneously handle the pre-defined and open-ended tasks, with LLM as a node feature enhancer or as a standalone predictor."
